channel.title: Gwt on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Gwt on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: GWT Button with image AND text
item.description: GWT just provides the basic widgets like check boxes, hyperlinks, buttons etc...and leave the more complex ones to the developer or to 3rd party providers.

item.title: Client-server communication peculiarities with GWT and App Engine DataNucleus
item.description: I just had to fight with a strange exception which got raised after a GWT-RPC call to the App Engine back-end server which had the purpose to persistently store an entity into the data store.

item.title: GWT Hyperlink Widget with Image
item.description: Standard GWT Hyperlink widgets don't seem to give the possibility to associate an image. This is quite awkward since you may want to provide nice icons along with your links.

item.title: GWT, App Engine and App Engine Data Classes
item.description: I currently have some time before starting with my Master thesis project which will bring me back to Android programming. So to make use of that, I started to develop a project I already wanted to implement a couple of years ago, but due to my Master studies I didn't have the time to.

item.title: DockLayoutPanel doesn't work correctly??
GWT DecoratorPanel style problems
item.description: I just experienced a nice side effect that happens if you use a DecoratorPanel. In my example it contained a list of items and everything is fine.

item.title: GWT meets Spring
item.description: GWT is quite evolving recently. There are a couple of reasons for that: Coding apps like Gmail and Google Wave We all appreciate the speed of the Gmail UI.

item.title: First steps with Silverlight. What about GWT?
item.description: Last week I had some time which allowed me to do some experiments with Microsoft Silverlight. I had to give it a try since you hear so much on the web about it, so I was quite curious, how it works out.

item.title: Strange GWT compiler error when trying to serialize Java objects
item.description: I'm currently working on a project on my own where I'm developing a rich client by using the Google Web toolkit and a server using the Spring application framework.
